description: '''Erin Elizabeth McCarley''' (born January 8, 1979) is an [[Indie folk|alternative music]] singer-songwriter. McCarley attended college at [[Baylor University]], and is now based in [[Nashville, Tennessee]]. She has been compared to [[Sara Bareilles]], [[Regina Spektor]], and [[Sheryl Crow]].  Erin released her follow-up to 2009's ''[[Love, Save the Empty]]'' on August 28, 2012, titled ''My Stadium Electric''.
